context: https://twitter.com/typesfast/status/1536406121249796096

I'm new to this field and always thought that SWE (at least the good ones) most definitely add value in exponential multiples over the 400k value but maybe I'm delusional by all the VC speak over twitter. Does he have a point and that we're mostly overpaid? Hope to hear some good points from experienced devs.
stories.title: Is 400k/yr overpaid for a SWE?

stories.text:
Many of us wake up to dozens of messages on Slack, feeling overwhelmed when we start our days.

My friends and I worked on a side project to help people manage this daily Slack struggle.

You can use Rewind (Slack app) to tag any message in your Slack workspace and find it easily later. Think of it like Slack’s saved items, but better.

You can use Rewind to tag a message as ‘todo’, ‘readlater’, ‘feature-research’, ‘togetback’, pretty much anything you would like. The app is great if you have a lot going on in your Slack.

I think many of us moved from Gmail to Slack and find it really hard to manage all the incoming messages, so I'm hoping Rewind will be useful for a lot of people.

Check it out here: https://www.rewindapp.io/
stories.title: Show HN: Slack app to manage messages overload
